feed.title: Leslie Huang | NYU
feed.subtitle: Hi there! I'm a computational social scientist and Data Science PhD candidate at NYU.

entry.title: stylest is on CRAN!
entry.content:
I am thrilled to announce that stylest, my package with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry, is now on CRAN!

You can install using install.packages("stylest") and start estimating textual speaker style distinctiveness!
entry.summary: I am thrilled to announce that stylest, my package with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry, is now on CRAN!

entry.title: Presenting at APSA
entry.content: At APSA 2018, the top conference in political science, I presented “Boring in a New Way: Estimation and Inference for Political Style at Westminster, 1935–2018,” a working paper with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry.
entry.summary: At APSA 2018, the top conference in political science, I presented “Boring in a New Way: Estimation and Inference for Political Style at Westminster, 1935–2018,” a working paper with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry.

entry.title: Presenting at PolMeth
entry.content:
At PolMeth 2018, I presented (with my co-author Arthur Spirling) “Boring in a New Way: Estimation and Inference for Political Style at Westminster, 1935–2018,” our working paper with Patrick Perry.

I also presented a poster for “Estimating the distribution of state power at the UN using topic models,” which was my Qualifying Paper.
entry.summary: At PolMeth 2018, I presented (with my co-author Arthur Spirling) “Boring in a New Way: Estimation and Inference for Political Style at Westminster, 1935–2018,” our working paper with Patrick Perry.

entry.title: Introducing stylest
entry.content:
I’m very excited to announce the alpha launch of stylest, an R package for estimating textual speaker distinctiveness. I am the maintainer for this package, which was created with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry.

  • Install stylest from GitHub. (On CRAN soon!)

  • View the vignette on GitHub.
entry.summary: I’m very excited to announce the alpha launch of stylest, an R package for estimating textual speaker distinctiveness. I am the maintainer for this package, which was created with Arthur Spirling and Patrick Perry.

entry.title: zipR demo
entry.content: I’ve added a new section for Software, and a quick introduction to an R library I wrote to implement zip().
entry.summary: I’ve added a new section for Software, and a quick introduction to an R library I wrote to implement zip().

entry.title: Sentiment analysis demo
entry.content:
I’ve added a demo of my sentiment analysis project that used statements from the FARC-Colombia peace negotiations to predict behavior of the government and the rebels.

Check it out!
entry.summary: I’ve added a demo of my sentiment analysis project that used statements from the FARC-Colombia peace negotiations to predict behavior of the government and the rebels.

entry.content: I’m pleased to re-launch my website, now built with Jekyll!
